channel.title: American Fisheries Society Ontario Chapter Annual Meeting on Erik K. Dean
channel.description: Recent content in American Fisheries Society Ontario Chapter Annual Meeting on Erik K. Dean

item.title: Bighead Carp overwintering under climate change â€” spawning, survival, and implications for invasion
item.description: 11 March 2023 Winner of the E.J. Crossman Award for Best Student Oral Presentation Abstract: Bighead Carp threatens to expand northward and invade the Laurentian Great Lakes, but there is uncertainty about whether the winter conditions encountered there could impose a population bottleneck. Population growth of Bighead Carp is highly sensitive to the survival of young-of-year (age-0), but this life stage is often implicated in population bottlenecks at northern latitudes.
